channel.title: Anyone leet with .htaccess?
channel.description:
ok, i saw how to do this on these forums a while ago, but cannot find it now
how do you "alias" a php script as another extension? eg: http://127.0.0.1/image.jpg executes http://127.0.0.1/image.php
i believe it used mod_rewrite, but none of the examples have helped me

item.title: Anyone leet with .htaccess?
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

Redirect /a.jpg http://victimsite.com/admin.asp&deleteuser

DONT PUT SPACES IN IT OR IT WILL GHEY UP!

lol is it a xss hack for like myspace or something :)?

Proof Of Concept

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone leet with .htaccess?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

dont you have to stick that into the httpd.conf ? im sure there was a way to do it using .htaccess :[br][size=1]Posted at: November 28, 2006, 06:08:12 PM[/size][hr]OK, i figured it out

RewriteEngine On RewriteRule image.jpg image.php

it turns out i didnt have the mod_rewrite module loaded

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone leet with .htaccess?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Have you tried:

AddType application/x-httpd-php .jpg

If it doesn’t work, you can always try the dirty “folder technique” of making a folder with name image.jpg and saving the script in as index.

Read full topic
